_header: Saint Julian the good harbinger of noble kind come
Subjects: saints’ lives; Julian Hosteler, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Julian Hosteler in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Iulian þe gode herbiour of noble kunne comStallward mon
                    & noble he was & louede cristendom…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…& atelaste þour godes wille þat we mote fleTo
                    þe Ioie of heuene & wiþþoute ende þer be

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint Iulian þe herbeger of gode kynne comestalworþ man
                    & noble he was & loued cristindome…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…& wente to þe ioye þat lestiþ wit oute
                    endenouȝ Ihesu for seint iulianes loue vs graunte þedir to
                    wende

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
SEint Iulian þe good herbigour of noble kuynde comStalwarde
                    mon and noble he was And louede cristendom…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Now bidde we ȝeorne seint Iulian þat he vr ernde
                    bedeÞat vr lord vs lete vr sunne bete and heuene haue to mede.
                    Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodLauMis108.First Lines:
SEint Iulian þe guode herebeger of noble kuynde comstaleward
                    and strong man he was and louede wel cristindom…
BodLauMis108.Last Lines:
…And at þe laste þoruȝ godes wille þat we moten
                    teoInto þe blisse of heuene and þare with outen ende
                    beo
BodLauMis108.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Early South-English Legendary.
EETS
         o.s. 87 (1887; repr. 1987): 256-60.

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint Julian þe gode hebiour of noble kyn comeStaluorp man he
                    was & noble & louede cristendom…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…And atte laste þorw godes wille þat we mowe fleoTo
                    þe Ioye of heuene & withouten ende þer beo
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

BodTan17.First Lines:
SEint Iulian þe goode herberiour of noble kyn comA stalworp
                    man & noble he was & louede cristindome…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…And atte laste dai þour goddis wille þat we mote
                    fleIn þe ioye of heuen & wiþ outen ende þere
                    be

OxfCCC431.First Lines:
[A] noper Iulian þer is þat men biddeþ fasteAfter
                    god In in vuked stede wanne hy beþ þere of agasteS[eint] Iulian
                    þe gode herbiger of noble kynne comStaleward man he was & louede
                    wel cristendom…
OxfCCC431.Last Lines:
…& ȝe scholle boþe wip alle ioye nywene come
                    himpo he hadde þis ised hy ne wiste ware he bicom…
OxfCCC431.Note:
Ends imperfectly due to mutilation at top of leaf, where text should end
                    on f. 14v.

CULAdd3039.First Lines:
Sayn Julyan þe gude herberioure of noble kynd he comeStalworth
                    man & noble he was & lufed cristendomeSolas he loued also ynoghe
                    boþe of haukeȝ & houndeNobler body þen he was þen
                    myght none be sonne þat stounde…
CULAdd3039.Last Lines:
…God for sayn Iulyane luf help vs at all oure nedeAnd lene us
                    grace to slake oure synnes & heven hafe till our mede

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Anoþer Iuliane þer is þat men biddeþ uasteAfter
                    god in strange stude wanne hi beþ þerof agaste…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
Sein Iulian þe gode herbigour of noble cunne comStalworde man
                    and noble he was & louede cristendom……And atte laste
                    þoru godes wille þat we mote fleTo þe ioie of heuene and
                    wiþ oute ende þer be
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 1.32-7.

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
AN oþer Seint Julian þer is þat men biddeþ
                    ffasteAfter goed herborw in straunge stede whanne men beoþ
                    agaste…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…And atte laste þorw godes wille þat we mote
                    ffleoAlle sunne in eorþe and atte laste in þo blisse of heuene
                    þat we beo
CamMagPep2344.Note:
Lines 1-25 and last 27 lines only, due to lost folio(s) between pages
                    118 and 121; pp. 119-120 should follow p. 122 (see 4571).

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint Iulian þe goud herbyger of noble kunde comeStalworþ
                    man he was & loued cristendom…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…Now bydde we seint Iulian þat he oure erande
                    bereÞat oure lord ous mulce ȝyue & al þat habbeþ
                    nede here

BLAdd10301.First Lines:
ANoþer seint Iulian þer is þat men biddeþ
                    fasteAftur gode herborugh in strange stude wan hi beþ þer of
                    agaste…
BLAdd10301.Last Lines:
…And atte laste þoru godes wille þat we mote fleto
                    þe Ioye of heuene and wiþ oute ende þer be

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEin Iulian þe gode herbiiour of noble ken comA stalworþe man & noble he was he louere cristendom…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …& atte laste þorou godes wille þat we mote fleto þe Ioie of heuen & without enþe þere be
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum x” added to left margin by later hand (f. 14v).

Digital Facsimile of British Library  Cotton Julius MS D IX.

BLCottTitAXXVI.First Lines:
Saynte Iulian the harbeiour of noblle kyne he was comynA stalworthe
                    man he was and lowyd crystendom…
BLCottTitAXXVI.Last Lines:
…& all men he made at casse as well as he cowthegod gyffe
                    vs grace theder to com where as he is nowe. Amen

BLEge1993.First Lines: Seint Iulian þe gode herbiger of noble kinde comStaleworþe mon he was & louede cristendom…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …Now bidde we seint Iulian þat he our ernde bedeþat our lord vs ȝiue milte & alle þat habbeþ nede

BLEge2810.First Lines: SEynt Iulian þe herbiger of gode Cunne comeStalewerþe man & noble he was & louid cristindome…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …Now bidde we seint Iulian þat he bidde vor usAnd bryng ous to þilke ioye þat he þer inne is

BLEge2891.First Lines: ANoþer sein Iulian þer is þat men biddeþ fasteAfter god in strong stude wanne hi beoþ þerof agaste…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …And atte laste þoru godes wille þat we mote fleoTo þe ioie of heuene and wiþ oute ende þere beo

BLHar2250.First Lines:
Saynt Iulian þe noble herbargeor of noble kynne he
                    comeStalworthe mon & noble he was & louyd
                    cristendome…
BLHar2250.Last Lines:
…Now pray we to saynt Iulian þat he our ernde
                    beedeÞat god vs graunte þrough our seruice þat gate þat
                    Iulian ȝede

Lam223.First Lines:
SAynt Iulyan þe noble herberiour of noble kynne he
                    comeStalworth man he ws ynogh þat loved
                    cristendome…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Now bid we to saynt Iulyan þat he oure ernde
                    bedeÞat god vs graunte þurȝ oure seruice þat gate
                    þat Iulian ȝede Amen

PROC473415.First Lines:
…As men and women doþ þat beoþ
                    wery of weiHe ȝede ner & sei þer liggon man & woman
                    alsoHe þouȝte þat þis is my wyf & a gedelyng
                    þat is icom hure toNou þe ich ise wel þe hore is ywoned to
                    misdo…
PROC473415.Note: 111 Lines; missing lines 1-44 due to loss of folio(s).

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Anoþer seint Iulian þer is to whom men bidden fasteAfter
                    good herbour in stronge place whan þei þerof ben
                    agaste…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…And þerto at goddis wille þat we mote fleeTo
                    þe ioie of heuene euere þerto be. Amen
